directions.description: Do not rinse steak. Pat dry and season generously on all sides with salt and pepper.
Heat a cast iron pan to medium-high heat.
Add half a tablespoon of olive oil to hot pan and spread. Place steak flat in pan and sear.
When steak is nicely browned on one side, flip and sear other side.
Quickly remove steak from pan with tongs, and discard cooking fat.
Put steak back in pan. Add butter. Baste.
Remove steak from pan. Rest on oven rack over baking pan (to catch juices), covered in foil.
Combine drippings with half tablespoon of olive oil. Carve steak against the grain, at an angle. Drizzle with oil/drippings. Finish with salt. Serve.
Bring pan plus butter to medium-low heat.
Sweat shallots (season with salt) until translucent.
Add cognac. Cook at high heat until alcohol burned off.
Add steak juices (if available) and veal stock. Reduce to a syrup-like consistency, still  at high heat.
Add cream and peppercorns - reduce until thickened.
Remove from heat. Season to taste. Allow to cool slightly. Serve.
